question: The anion gap in a healthy indiviual is around ___.
exp: Anion Gap: The total concentration of cation and anions in the body fluids expressed as m. Eq/L. This is required to maintain electrical neutrality. The commonly measured electrolytes in the plasma are Na+, K+, Cl- and HCO3- Sodium and potassium together accounts for 85% of the cations, whereas chloride and bicarbonate account for 86% of the anions. Hence, there is always a difference between the measured cations and anions. It is due to the presence of protein, anions, sulphates, phosphates. Anion gap is defined as the difference in between the total concentration of measured cation (Na+ and K+) and that of measured anion (Cl- and HCO3-). NA+ + K+ = Cl- + HCO3-+ A- 136 + 4 = 100 + 25 + A- A- = 15 m. Eq/L. The anion gap in a healthy individual is around 15 m. Eq/L (range of 8-18 m. Eq/L)

question: A nucleic acid was analyzed and found to contain 32% adenine, 18% guanine, 17% cytosine and 33% thymine. The nucleic acid must be -

The total amount of purines (i. e. adenine and guanine) equals the total amount of pyrimidines (i. e. cytosine & thymine) In the given question purines (adenine 32% & guanine 18%) are equal to pyrimidines (thymine 33% & cytosine 17%). question: In which of the following conditions is the synthesis of hepcidin not reduced?
exp: Inorganic iron is transported into the mucosal cell by a proton-linked divalent metal ion transporter, and accumulated intracellularly by binding to ferritin. Iron leaves the mucosal cell via a transport protein ferroportin, but only if there is free transferrin in plasma to bind to. Once transferrin is saturated with iron, any that has accumulated in the mucosal cells is lost when the cells are shed. Expression of the ferroportin gene (and possibly also that for the divalent metal ion transporter) is downregulated by hepcidin, a peptide secreted by the liver when body iron reserves are adequate. In response to hypoxia, anemia, or hemorrhage, the synthesis of hepcidin is reduced, leading to increased synthesis of ferroportin and increased iron absorption. As a result of this mucosal barrier, only ∼10% of dietary iron is absorbed, and only 1% to 5% from many plant foods. Hemosiderosis is an iron overload condition and further iron absorption is not required. HARPERS ILLUSTRATED BIOCHEMISTRY30th ed. page no. 541

question: CRP is a protein seen in ceain systemic inflammatory conditions. Here 'C' stands for:
exp: C-reactive protein (CRP, so named because it reacts with the C polysaccharide of pneumococci) is an acute phase protein. It can stimulate the classic complement pathway. CRP is used as a marker of tissue injury, infection, and inflammation, and there is considerable interest in its use as a predictor of ceain types of cardiovascular conditions secondary to atherosclerosis. Ref: Murray R. K., Jacob M., Varghese J. (2011). Chapter 50. Plasma Proteins & Immunoglobulins. In D. A. Bender, K. M. Botham, P. A. Weil, P. J. Kennelly, R. K. Murray, V. W. Rodwell (Eds), Harper's Illustrated Biochemistry, 29e.

question: Which of the following test is used to differentiate the chromosome of normal and cancer cells?
exp: Comparative genomic hybridization (CGH) is a method that can be used only when DNA is available from a specimen of interest. This technology has been used to study cryptic chromosomal imbalances in patients with mental retardation and multiple congenital anomalies, as well as in prenatal diagnosis. It has also been used to detect microdeletions and microduplications in cancer and in previously unidentified genomic disorders. Ref: Schwaz S., Hassold T. (2012). Chapter 62. Chromosome Disorders. In D. L. Longo, A. S. Fauci, D. L. Kasper, S. L. Hauser, J. L. Jameson, J. Loscalzo (Eds), Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 18e

question: In vitamin C deficiency, post-translational modification of which amino acid is defective
exp: Vitamin C is required for post-translational hydroxylation of proline and lysine residue.
